edu.stanford.math.plex4.metric.landmark
Class RandomLandmarkSelector<T>

java.lang.Object
  edu.stanford.math.plex4.metric.landmark.LandmarkSelector<T>
      edu.stanford.math.plex4.metric.landmark.RandomLandmarkSelector<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the underlying metric space
All Implemented Interfaces:
AbstractIntMetricSpace, AbstractObjectMetric<T>, AbstractObjectMetricSpace<T>, AbstractSearchableMetricSpace<T>
public class RandomLandmarkSelector<T>
extends LandmarkSelector<T>

This class defines a landmark set in a finite metric space by random selection.

Author:
Andrew Tausz

Constructor Detail

RandomLandmarkSelector

public RandomLandmarkSelector(AbstractSearchableMetricSpace<T> metricSpace,
                              int landmarkSetSize)
This constructor initializes the landmark selector with a finite metric space, and a size parameter.

Parameters:
metricSpace - the metric space to build the landmarks set in
landmarkSetSize - the size of the landmark set
Method Detail

computeLandmarkSet

protected int[] computeLandmarkSet()
Description copied from class: LandmarkSelector
This function constructs the set of landmark points. It must return an array of size landmarkSetSize, which contains the indices of the landmark points within the metric space.

Specified by:
computeLandmarkSet in class LandmarkSelector<T>
Returns:
an array of indices corresponding to the landmark points in the metric space
